page.title: 19 Newton Bromswold Village
page.content: The village only has 16 houses, a mixture of bungalows, cottages, farms, a Manor house and the church. We found there was a very friendly atmosphere. The villagers said that it was quiet, lovely and friendly, they preferred it to the busy towns. Most villagers shopped in Rushden or other nearby towns but there was no bus so they relied upon cars. Sometimes they used the small shop/Post office at the end of Avenue Road. Most people worked in Rushden or the nearby farm. One person was unemployed. There was once a village school but this was closed over 20 years ago. The children are now Â£bused' and the school has been demolished and built upon. There are no mains gas or sewer, they use either oil or coal. It costs 27 pounds 50p to empty their cess pits. They don't have street lights either.
